Description.val:
The Anti-Submarine Warfare (ASW) Mission Package (MP) enables the Littoral Combat Ship (LCS) to conduct detect-to-engage operations against modern submarines that pose a threat. Specific ASW capabilities include protecting forces in transit, protecting joint operating areas, and establishing ASW barriers. The ASW MP is developed to provide the warfighter capabilities that can be employed for ASW area search as well as high value unit escort missions and composed of an Escort Mission Module (EMM), a Torpedo Defense Module (TDM), and an Aviation Module.  The EMM components include a Variable Depth Sonar (VDS), a Multi-Function Towed Array (MFTA), associated winch and handling equipment, and a Mission Package Computing Environment (MPCE) Sonar Signal Processing suite. The Torpedo Defense Module utilizes the Light Weight Tow Torpedo countermeasures system, associated winch and handling equipment, and a control station. The Aviation Module provides airborne threat localization and engagement capability through an MH-60R helicopter with MK54 torpedoes and sonobuoys, as well as associated storing and handling gear. The ability to incorporate a Fire Scout Vertical Takeoff and Landing Unmanned Aerial Vehicle is an additional capability within the Aviation Module.

An ASW MP is deployable and capable of meeting its focused mission requirements on an LCS only when it includes the full complement of Common Mission Modules Equipment (Line Item Number 1600) and the full complement of mission systems that comprise the LCS ASW Mission Module (Line Item Number 1602). If mission systems are removed from the mission module in any given Fiscal Year, the ASW Mission Package will be non-deployable until the mission system is replaced in a subsequent Fiscal Year.

The number of LCS ASW MPs must not only keep pace with the number of ships, additional MPs are required to account for those that will be forward staged or unavailable due to periodic maintenance requirements.

Other Related Budgets: BLIs: OPN 1600, OPN 1601, OPN 1603, RDT&E 0603596N

[P5 / (AS001) - ASW Escort Module]: The ASW Escort Mission Module (MM) contains the sensors and signal processing required to detect, classify and localize submarine threats.  The Escort MM consists of two towed sensors; a Variable Depth Sonar (VDS) active source and a Multi Function Towed Array (MFTA) passive/bi-static active receiver; launch, handling and recovery equipment for the towed sensors, and AN/SQQ-89 V(15) active and passive signal processing applications.

[P5 / (AS002) - Torpedo Defense Countermeasure Module]: The Light Weight Tow (LWT) system is a towed persistent torpedo countermeasure optimized for use in littoral conditions.  LWT is a standalone autonomous system capable of defeating threat torpedoes through soft-kill to independently increase LCS Platform Probability of Survival.

[P5 / (AS005) - ASW Mission Package Support Equipment and Containers]: The foundation of each ASW Support Container (SC) is an International Organization for Standardization (ISO) compliant shipping container. The ISO shipping containers are outfitted with Unistrut rails (for shelving and drawer attachments), lighting (standard/emergency), fire/smoke alarms, service panels for power, and a circuit breaker box. From this base container configuration, a variety of racks, cradles, and handling gear can be installed as needed to form a SC.

[P5 / ASW Support Containers]: The foundation of each ASW Support Container (SC) is an International Organization for Standardization (ISO) compliant shipping container. The ISO shipping containers are outfitted with Unistrut rails (for shelving and drawer attachments), lighting (standard/emergency), fire/smoke alarms, service panels for power, and a circuit breaker box. From this base container configuration, a variety of racks, cradles, and handling gear can be installed as needed to form a SC.

[P5 / (AS900) - Consulting Services]: Provides program management support, engineering and technical support, studies, analysis and evaluation on mission module systems.

Justification.val:
FY 2020 funds the procurement of one ASW MP, to include associated support equipment.  This is a new start.

The Navy in coordination with the prime contractor of the Escort Mission Module (EMM) Pre-Production Test Article (PPTA) completed acoustic characterization, end-to-end integration testing, and two phases of dockside testing in 3Q FY 2018 and 4Q FY 2018.  The Navy took delivery of the EMM PPTA in Q1 FY 2019.  Following delivery, the Navy initiated white ship testing in January 2019 to characterize hydrodynamic performance.  LCS ship modification planning and design efforts have completed, and the Navy plans to begin modifications to USS Fort Worth (LCS 3) in Q2 FY 2019 and complete in Q3 FY 2019.  Once complete, the ASW MP will be embarked in Q3 FY 2019 and commence formal testing Q4 FY 2019, which will complete in Q2 FY2020.

Name.@footnote: The VDS is an acoustic source that can be towed at the speeds required to perform effective ASW search from the LCS.  The VDS is a Dual Mode Array Transmitter (DART), and together with the MFTA and Sonar Signal Processing System, provides an in-stride and rapid ASW escort and large area search capability for the Escort Mission Module.

This cost element funds Engineering Change Proposals (ECPs) required for the production of the Escort Mission Module's Varible Depth Sonar (VDS).  These ECPs include upgrades to support the additional snag load requirement, cyber security enhancements, and other ECPs discovered during testing.
Name.val: 1.1.2) Variable Depth Sonar Engineering Change Proposals

Name.@footnote: The Multi-Function Towed Array (MFTA) is a Program of Record (PoR) system in production and that is integrated into the AS/SQQ-89A(V)15 and installed aboard Arleigh Burke Class guided missile destroyers and Ticonderoga Class cruisers.  The MFTA is being integrated into the ASW Mission Package as part of the Escort Mission Module.  The MFTA is paired with the VDS will provide both a transit speed ASW Escort and Barrier/Area search capability as well as torpedo alert capability.

Name.val: (AS005) - ASW Mission Package Support Equipment and Containers

Name.@footnote: ASW MP Support Equipment funds will be to procure the following items: Variable Depth Sonar (VDS) Crate, VDS tow cable, VDS reel pallet,  Multi-Function Towed Array (MFTA) reel pallet, MFTA tow cable reel pallet, Ramp Spanning Structure and Stern Door Cofferdam Flat Rack, Cabinets for Sonobuoys, Closed-Circuit TVs, and Expendable Bathythermographs (XBT) probes.

Model.val: ASW Mission Package Light Weight Tow

ImplementationMethodName.val: [none specified]:: Installation Name: ASW MP Kits

Description.val:
For LCS Freedom variant, seaframe changes include installation of a fairlead and bellmouth thru the starboard transom, and a winch foundation.  For LCS Independence variant, seaframe changes include installation of a fairlead and bellmouth through the starboard amah, a winch foundation, and a sheave.

[ASW MP Kits] Funds the modifications to the current LCS designs to accommodate the ASW mission package configuration. All LCS ships will require the installation of the ASW Ship Alteration.
